requirements.text: The project shall define and record the licensing basis and code-of-record for the condenser, including applicable regulations, incorporated codes/standards, and edition/addenda where required.

verification.acceptance: Documented licensing basis and code-of-record exists and is under configuration control.

requirements.text: The condenser function, boundaries, and interfaces (turbine exhaust, condensate/hotwell, circulating water, vacuum/air removal, drains/vents) shall be documented in controlled system descriptions and P&IDs.

verification.acceptance: Controlled documentation defines condenser boundaries and interfaces and matches as-built configuration.

requirements.text: The safety classification, quality group, and seismic design classification for the condenser and its subcomponents shall be established and justified.

verification.acceptance: Classification basis exists and is traceable to plant design criteria and licensing basis.

requirements.text: Design life for the condenser pressure boundary and tube bundle shall be specified as {{design_life_years}} years and used for sizing, corrosion allowances, and aging management.

verification.acceptance: Design life is specified and reflected in design calculations and procurement requirements.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be designed to support plant availability and heat rate objectives, including an availability target of {{availability_target}}% where specified.

verification.acceptance: Reliability/availability targets are defined and design provisions support meeting the targets.

requirements.text: A configuration management plan shall identify critical-to-function condenser attributes (vacuum integrity, tube materials, tube-to-tubesheet joints, air removal capacity) that require formal change control.

verification.acceptance: Configuration management artifacts exist and include condenser critical attributes.

requirements.text: A hazard evaluation shall identify credible condenser-related plant transients (loss of vacuum, circulating water transient, tube leak, water induction, air inleakage) and define design/operational controls.

verification.acceptance: Documented hazard evaluation exists and design controls/alarms are traceable.

requirements.text: Procurement specifications shall define required materials, inspections, tests, documentation, and hold points for condenser fabrication and tube bundle manufacture.

verification.acceptance: Procurement package includes defined requirements and QA hold points.

requirements.text: The condenser design shall include provisions for foreign material exclusion (FME) during maintenance and outage work (waterbox entry, tube cleaning, tube plugging).

verification.acceptance: Design includes FME provisions (covers, screens, access, labeling) and procedures reference them.

requirements.text: For plants with radiological contamination potential of condensate, requirements for radiation monitoring and sampling at the hotwell/condensate system shall be defined.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring/sampling requirements are documented and traceable to plant programs.

requirements.text: The condenser shall have an identified preventive maintenance and inspection basis consistent with AP-913 or equivalent reliability program.

verification.acceptance: Preventive maintenance basis exists, is risk-informed, and includes condition indicators.

requirements.text: Design calculations shall establish design and service load combinations for the condenser, including vacuum/external pressure, waterbox pressure, thermal expansion, and seismic where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Load combinations and acceptance criteria are documented and meet code-of-record.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be included in the plant's corrective action program with defined performance indicators (vacuum performance, air inleakage, tube leak rate, CW ΔT) and thresholds.

verification.acceptance: Performance indicators and thresholds are defined and trended.

requirements.text: The project shall define acceptance criteria for tube plugging percentage (e.g., limit {{tube_plugging_limit_percent}}%) and its impact on performance and end-of-life planning.

verification.acceptance: Plugging limits and associated performance impacts are documented.

requirements.text: Where environmental permitting applies, the condenser cooling water intake/discharge requirements (temperature, chemicals, flow) shall be captured as design inputs.

verification.acceptance: Permit-driven requirements are captured as design inputs and flowed down to design/procurement.

requirements.text: The condenser design shall specify required qualifications for special processes (welding, tube-to-tubesheet joining, coatings/linings) including procedure and personnel qualification.

verification.acceptance: Qualified procedures and personnel records exist for special processes.

requirements.text: A records package shall be maintained for the condenser including material certs, NDE records, hydro/leak tests, as-built drawings, and performance test results.

verification.acceptance: Complete records package exists and is retrievable under document control.

requirements.text: The condenser scope shall define whether it is treated as a pressure vessel to ASME VIII, a heat exchanger to TEMA/HEI, and/or power piping to ASME B31.1 for connected piping.

verification.acceptance: Code applicability statement exists and is consistent with system classification and licensing basis.

requirements.text: The project shall identify and control critical spare parts for condenser operability (air removal equipment spares, instrumentation, gaskets, plugs/sleeves).

verification.acceptance: Critical spares list exists with stocking levels and replenishment plan.

requirements.text: For marine/outdoor environments, the condenser design shall explicitly address corrosion/biofouling risks in the operating profile and define mitigation measures.

verification.acceptance: Mitigation measures (material selection, coatings, CP, treatment) are defined for the environmental profile.

requirements.text: The condenser shall connect to the turbine exhaust hood with defined geometry and sealing provisions to prevent air inleakage and water induction.

verification.acceptance: Interface drawings specify geometry/seals and installation records confirm conformance.

requirements.text: The condenser hotwell shall provide condensate inventory of at least {{hotwell_volume}} and support stable level control over the operating range.

verification.acceptance: Hotwell volume and level control stability are demonstrated by design and commissioning test.

requirements.text: The condenser shall interface with the condensate/feedwater system to meet NPSH and suction conditions for condensate pumps with margin ≥ {{condensate_pump_npsh_margin_min}}.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic analysis demonstrates NPSH margin is met for all operating conditions.

requirements.text: Connections for drains and vents shall be provided to support startup, shutdown, and maintenance, including capability to fully drain waterboxes and low points.

verification.acceptance: P&IDs and physical layout show drains/vents at required locations and accessible for operation.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to prevent turbine water induction, including hotwell level control, alarms, and physical separation/deflectors as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Water induction prevention features are implemented and verified during commissioning.

requirements.text: The circulating water (CW) inlet/outlet nozzles shall be sized for design flow {{cw_flowrate_design}} and limit CW pressure drop to ≤ {{cw_pressure_drop_max}}.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic calculations show CW pressure drop meets the limit at design flow.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be compatible with the selected cooling system {{cooling_system}} and cooling water source {{cooling_water_source}}, including provisions for debris handling and chemical treatment interfaces.

verification.acceptance: Interfaces for treatment, screening, and debris control are defined and consistent with cooling system selection.

requirements.text: Where traveling screens or intake screening are used, the condenser CW interface shall accommodate expected debris load without unacceptable fouling or flow restriction.

verification.acceptance: Design basis debris loading is defined and intake/screen design supports required CW flow.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include isolation provisions for waterboxes (valves/blinds) to support maintenance without draining the entire CW system as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Isolation points are shown on P&IDs and accessible; maintenance procedure supports isolation.

requirements.text: Interfaces for online tube cleaning systems (e.g., sponge ball) shall be defined, including strainers, ball collectors, and monitoring points.

verification.acceptance: Online cleaning interfaces and components are installed and tested for functional circulation.

requirements.text: The condenser shell and support arrangement shall accommodate differential thermal expansion between shell, tubes, and supporting structures without overstress.

verification.acceptance: Thermal expansion analysis demonstrates stresses and movements are within allowable limits.

requirements.text: The condenser shall provide physical access paths and laydown areas for tube bundle inspection/cleaning and waterbox maintenance.

verification.acceptance: Layout drawings and field walkdowns confirm access paths and laydown provisions.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include connections for vacuum/air removal system tie-ins sized for required hogging/holding capacities.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle sizes and piping design meet air removal capacity requirements and are verified by calculation.

requirements.text: Instrumentation taps and penetrations shall be located to avoid creating air pockets, stagnant zones, or erosion/corrosion hot spots.

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation location review confirms good practice placement and minimizes adverse effects.

requirements.text: The condenser shall interface with plant chemistry sampling systems, including hotwell sample points and CW sample points as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Sampling points are provided, accessible, and consistent with plant chemistry program.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to limit steam-side pressure excursions (e.g., relief/rupture devices) if required by the code-of-record and design basis.

verification.acceptance: Overpressure protection basis and devices are defined and meet applicable code requirements.

requirements.text: Electrical interfaces for vacuum pumps, screen drives, and instrumentation shall conform to plant electrical standards and applicable codes (e.g., NFPA 70).

verification.acceptance: Electrical interface requirements are defined and installation meets applicable codes/standards.

requirements.text: Where the condenser is located in flood-prone areas, interfaces (penetrations, vents, drains) shall be configured to support flood protection strategy.

verification.acceptance: Flood protection features are defined and consistent with site flood hazard strategy.

requirements.text: The condenser shall provide grounding/bonding provisions for corrosion control systems (e.g., impressed current CP) and electrical safety.

verification.acceptance: Grounding/bonding provisions exist and are verified during installation checks.

requirements.text: A system interface matrix shall be maintained identifying all interfaces and responsibilities among turbine-generator, condensate/feedwater, CW, vacuum, chemistry, and I&C systems.

verification.acceptance: Interface matrix exists, is current, and is referenced in design reviews.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be rated for a thermal duty of {{thermal_duty_rated}} MW at defined design conditions (steam flow, CW flow {{cw_flowrate_design}}, CW inlet temperature {{cw_inlet_temp_design}}).

verification.acceptance: Heat balance and performance testing demonstrate rated duty at defined conditions within tolerance.

requirements.text: The condenser shall maintain turbine exhaust pressure/backpressure ≤ {{backpressure_limit}} kPa_abs at the rated condition.

verification.acceptance: Measured or calculated backpressure meets the specified limit at rated condition.

requirements.text: The condenser approach temperature shall be ≤ {{approach_temperature_max}} at rated condition.

verification.acceptance: Performance evidence shows approach temperature meets the limit at rated condition.

requirements.text: The terminal temperature difference (TTD) shall be ≤ {{terminal_temperature_difference_max}} at rated condition.

verification.acceptance: Performance evidence shows TTD meets the limit at rated condition.

requirements.text: The condenser shall meet specified performance over the defined operating envelope including minimum load, maximum load, and seasonal CW inlet temperature variation.

verification.acceptance: Off-design performance model demonstrates acceptance over the envelope with stated assumptions.

requirements.text: Fouling factor allowance of {{fouling_factor_allowance}} shall be included in thermal design and reflected in tube count/area selection.

verification.acceptance: Thermal design incorporates fouling allowance and meets performance margins.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be designed to avoid excessive condensate subcooling; condensate subcooling shall be ≤ {{condensate_subcooling_max}} unless otherwise required.

verification.acceptance: Design analysis demonstrates subcooling meets limit across operating range.

requirements.text: The condenser shall accommodate the maximum steam flowrate {{steam_flowrate_max}} without tube erosion, excessive pressure drop, or unacceptable performance degradation.

verification.acceptance: Steam-side pressure drop and velocity criteria meet limits at maximum steam flow.

requirements.text: CW-side velocity in tubes shall be limited to ≤ {{cw_velocity_tube_max}} m/s to manage erosion and vibration risk for the selected tube material.

verification.acceptance: Calculated CW velocity meets limit for all operating conditions.

requirements.text: The condenser shall provide adequate deaeration to support condensate/feedwater chemistry targets (e.g., dissolved oxygen ≤ {{dissolved_oxygen_max}} ppb) when applicable.

verification.acceptance: Commissioning test or analysis demonstrates DO targets are achievable with specified operation.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be designed to minimize air-binding and ensure effective condensate drainage from tube bundle surfaces under all normal operating attitudes.

verification.acceptance: Design review confirms drainage paths and steam distribution support effective drainage.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions for performance monitoring (e.g., CW inlet/outlet temperatures, CW flow, vacuum, heat balance) to support heat rate management.

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation list and DCS points support performance monitoring calculations.

requirements.text: Pressure losses on the CW side shall be controlled to meet pump/fan system capability and avoid cavitation or air ingestion at low intake levels.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic analysis demonstrates CW pump operating point and NPSH margins are met.

requirements.text: The condenser design shall address startup conditions including hogging operation, warm-up, and rapid load changes without violating stress or leakage limits.

verification.acceptance: Transient analysis and procedures show startup/load change conditions are within design limits.

requirements.text: The condenser shall tolerate specified CW temperature extremes ({{cw_min_temp}} to {{cw_max_temp}}) without unacceptable thermal stresses or leakage.

verification.acceptance: Thermal stress assessment demonstrates acceptable stresses for CW temperature extremes.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to manage condensate quality excursions (e.g., high conductivity) including alarms and operational response guidance.

verification.acceptance: Alarms/response guidance are implemented and validated during commissioning drills or reviews.

requirements.text: At maximum duty {{thermal_duty_max}} (if specified), the condenser shall maintain vacuum above {{vacuum_min}} kPa_abs with the air removal system in service.

verification.acceptance: Analysis/test demonstrates vacuum criteria met at maximum duty and bounding conditions.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be designed to prevent reheat of condensate (hotwell) that would degrade NPSH or chemistry control during low load operation.

verification.acceptance: Thermal/hydraulic analysis indicates acceptable hotwell temperature and NPSH margin at low load.

requirements.text: Performance acceptance criteria and tolerances shall be defined using a recognized standard ({{performance_test_standard}}) and referenced in procurement/testing plans.

verification.acceptance: Procurement/testing documents specify the performance standard and acceptance tolerances.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be designed such that expected tube plugging up to {{tube_plugging_limit_percent}}% does not violate minimum performance requirements during its life-cycle plan.

verification.acceptance: End-of-life performance analysis demonstrates requirements are met with plugging allowance.

requirement_sets.category: 4. Vacuum system, air removal, and noncondensible gas control

requirements.text: The condenser shell and connected vacuum boundary shall be designed and installed to meet vacuum integrity requirements, including a maximum allowable leak rate of {{max_allowable_leak_rate}} Pa-m3/s (or project-specific).

verification.acceptance: Vacuum boundary leak test meets the specified leak rate limit.

requirements.text: The air removal system type shall be defined as {{air_removal_system_type}} and sized for the required hogging capacity {{hogging_capacity}} and holding capacity {{holding_capacity}}.

verification.acceptance: Sizing calculations demonstrate hogging/holding capacities meet requirements.

requirements.text: The design shall specify an allowable condenser air inleakage rate not exceeding {{air_inleakage_rate_max}} kg/h at rated conditions.

verification.acceptance: Air inleakage target is specified and design features minimize inleakage points.

requirements.text: Where steam jet ejectors are used, the design shall specify motive steam conditions, nozzle sizing, and inter/after-condensers to achieve required performance.

verification.acceptance: Ejector design package includes motive steam assumptions and meets required capacity.

requirements.text: Where liquid ring or dry vacuum pumps are used, the design shall specify seal fluid requirements, cooling, NPSH (if applicable), and motor sizing.

verification.acceptance: Vacuum pump design data meets operating envelope and utilities are defined.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include vents and extraction points located to remove noncondensibles from high points and stagnant zones in accordance with good practice.

verification.acceptance: Vent/extraction locations are shown on drawings and align with design review criteria.

requirements.text: The air removal system shall include isolation and bypass provisions to allow maintenance and alternate alignment while maintaining condenser vacuum as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Isolation/bypass valves and procedures support required alignments and are functionally tested.

requirements.text: Instrumentation shall be provided to measure condenser vacuum/pressure with redundancy commensurate with plant alarm philosophy.

verification.acceptance: Installed transmitters and alarms meet redundancy and accuracy requirements.

requirements.text: Vacuum breaker(s) or controlled venting provisions shall be provided to protect against vacuum-induced structural collapse during abnormal conditions and to support controlled shutdown.

verification.acceptance: Design includes vacuum breaker provisions and functional testing demonstrates operation.

requirements.text: The design shall include interlocks/controls to prevent starting air removal equipment under damaging conditions (e.g., insufficient seal fluid, closed isolation).

verification.acceptance: Interlocks are implemented and tested as part of commissioning.

requirements.text: The air removal system discharge handling shall be defined (vent stack, treatment, monitoring) consistent with plant environmental and radiological requirements.

verification.acceptance: Discharge path is defined and meets applicable plant requirements.

requirements.text: Noncondensible gas removal capacity shall be ≥ {{noncondensible_removal_capacity}} kg/h under bounding operating conditions.

verification.acceptance: Capacity is demonstrated by vendor data and/or site test to meet requirement.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to locate and trend air inleakage sources (e.g., ultrasonic leak detection ports, segmented testing) as part of maintenance strategy.

verification.acceptance: Design supports leak detection access and maintenance procedure uses it.

requirements.text: Where inter/after-condensers are present, condensate drainage and venting shall be designed to prevent flooding and maintain ejector/vacuum pump performance.

verification.acceptance: Drain/vent design prevents flooding under operating conditions and is verified by calculation.

requirements.text: The vacuum boundary shall minimize gasketed joints and penetrations; remaining penetrations shall be designed for reliable sealing and ease of leak testing.

verification.acceptance: Design review confirms minimized joints and specifies sealing methods suitable for vacuum service.

requirements.text: The design shall address transients that may introduce large air loads (startup, condenser shell opening, low vacuum events) and ensure recovery capability.

verification.acceptance: Recovery capability is demonstrated by analysis and startup test observations.

requirements.text: Condenser steam-side pressure measurement points shall be located and shielded to provide representative values without excessive noise/vibration effects.

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation placement provides stable readings and meets accuracy requirements.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to prevent water carryover into air removal equipment (knockout pots, separators) where required.

verification.acceptance: Separator/knockout provisions are installed and demonstrated during commissioning.

requirements.text: For plants with radiological monitoring requirements, the air removal discharge path shall include sampling/monitoring provisions as defined by the plant program.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring provisions exist and are consistent with plant radiological program.

requirements.text: Vacuum system components classified as important to safety shall meet applicable seismic and environmental qualification requirements.

verification.acceptance: Qualification documentation exists demonstrating seismic/EQ compliance for applicable components.

requirement_sets.category: 5. Heat transfer surfaces: tube bundle design and layout

requirements.text: The tube bundle heat transfer area shall be sized to meet rated performance, considering fouling allowance and conservative heat transfer coefficients.

verification.acceptance: Thermal design calculations demonstrate required area and margins.

requirements.text: Tube material shall be specified as {{tube_material}} based on cooling water chemistry and corrosion/fouling risk.

verification.acceptance: Material selection basis documents compatibility with CW chemistry and operating conditions.

requirements.text: Tube outside diameter and wall thickness ({{tube_od}} mm, {{tube_wall_thickness}} mm) shall be selected to meet pressure/vibration margins and cleaning considerations.

verification.acceptance: Design calculations show adequate margins for selected tube dimensions.

requirements.text: Tube length {{tube_length}} and count {{tube_count}} shall be selected to meet thermal duty while limiting CW pressure drop and maintaining acceptable velocities.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic and thermal calculations demonstrate acceptance for tube length/count selection.

requirements.text: Tube layout {{tube_layout}} and pitch {{tube_pitch}} shall be selected to balance heat transfer, cleanliness, and mechanical integrity, consistent with recognized standards.

verification.acceptance: Layout selection is documented and meets applicable spacing and cleaning requirements.

requirements.text: The tube-to-tubesheet joint method {{tube_to_tubesheet_joint}} shall be specified and qualified to provide leak tightness and mechanical integrity for the life cycle.

verification.acceptance: Qualification evidence exists for joint method including leak tightness and pullout strength as applicable.

requirements.text: Tubesheets shall be designed for differential pressure, thermal gradients, and tube loads, including tube rolling/welding stresses where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Tubesheet stress analysis meets allowable limits under defined load cases.

requirements.text: Waterbox partition plates and pass arrangements shall ensure uniform CW distribution and minimize flow-induced vibration and erosion.

verification.acceptance: CFD or hydraulic analysis and design review demonstrate acceptable distribution and velocity limits.

requirements.text: Steam distribution devices (baffles/diffusers) shall be designed to minimize impingement erosion and promote uniform condensation across the tube bundle.

verification.acceptance: Design review and calculations demonstrate acceptable steam velocities and impingement protection.

requirements.text: Impingement plates (if used) shall be designed to protect tubes from high-velocity exhaust steam droplets and erosion.

verification.acceptance: Impingement plate design meets thickness/support requirements and is included in as-built inspection.

requirements.text: Tube supports (support plates/rod baffles) shall be designed to limit vibration and tube wear while accommodating thermal expansion.

verification.acceptance: Support design analysis demonstrates vibration limits and acceptable wear margins.

requirements.text: Provisions shall be included to minimize condensate flooding of tubes, including adequate drainage paths and hotwell return arrangements.

verification.acceptance: Drainage analysis and design review confirm no chronic flooding regions under design conditions.

requirements.text: The design shall include adequate clearances and access for tube cleaning equipment consistent with the specified tube cleaning method {{tube_cleaning_method}}.

verification.acceptance: Layout provides access/clearances for cleaning equipment and meets maintenance plan needs.

requirements.text: For online ball cleaning systems, tube inlet/outlet hardware shall be designed to avoid ball hang-up and minimize tube entrance erosion.

verification.acceptance: Design incorporates proven ball injection/collection hardware; functional testing demonstrates circulation.

requirements.text: Tube bundle shall include debris protection features (inlet screens/strainers) commensurate with expected CW debris loading.

verification.acceptance: Debris loading basis is defined and protection features are installed and accessible.

requirements.text: Waterbox design shall allow complete drainage and venting for inspection/maintenance, including provisions for confined space entry where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Drain/vent points and access features support complete drainage and safe entry.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to isolate and remove tube bundle sections or components if the design supports modular replacement.

verification.acceptance: Design documentation defines modularity and removal paths where applicable.

requirements.text: Tubesheet cladding, coatings, or linings ({{tube_sheet_coating}}) shall be specified to manage corrosion consistent with CW chemistry and materials pairing.

verification.acceptance: Coating/lining specification is defined and compatible with environment and materials.

requirements.text: Waterbox lining ({{waterbox_lining}}) shall be specified where needed to mitigate corrosion/erosion in aggressive cooling water environments.

verification.acceptance: Lining selection basis and QA inspection criteria are documented.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to prevent galvanic corrosion between dissimilar metals in tubes/tubesheets/waterboxes, including insulating sleeves or compatible material pairing.

verification.acceptance: Galvanic assessment demonstrates acceptable corrosion risk and defines mitigation features.

requirement_sets.category: 6. Materials, corrosion, erosion, fouling, and biofouling control

requirements.text: Materials exposed to cooling water shall be selected based on the defined CW chemistry program {{cw_chemistry_program}} and the water source {{cooling_water_source}}.

verification.acceptance: Materials selection basis matches CW chemistry and source conditions.

requirements.text: For seawater/brackish service, tube materials and waterbox linings shall be selected to mitigate pitting, crevice corrosion, and MIC.

verification.acceptance: Design documentation demonstrates suitability for seawater/brackish conditions and includes MIC controls.

requirements.text: Where copper alloy tubes are used, the design shall address ammonia attack/impingement corrosion risk and define chemistry controls.

verification.acceptance: Chemistry controls and material suitability assessment are documented.

requirements.text: Where stainless or duplex stainless tubes are used, the design shall address chloride SCC risk, temperature limits, and crevice corrosion mitigation.

verification.acceptance: Assessment documents SCC/crevice corrosion controls and suitable alloy selection.

requirements.text: Where titanium tubes are used, the design shall address erosion at high velocities, galvanic coupling to tubesheets, and installation controls to prevent hydrogen pickup.

verification.acceptance: Design includes velocity limits, galvanic mitigation, and installation controls for titanium tubes.

requirements.text: The design shall include a fouling/biofouling control strategy appropriate to the cooling water source and environmental constraints, including {{biofouling_control_method}} where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Fouling strategy is defined, implementable, and consistent with permits and plant programs.

requirements.text: If chlorination/bromination is used, chemical dosing limits and monitoring shall comply with permit and environmental requirements ({{chlorination_limits}}).

verification.acceptance: Permit limits are captured and dosing/monitoring provisions are implemented.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions for periodic mechanical cleaning consistent with the specified tube cleaning method {{tube_cleaning_method}}.

verification.acceptance: Cleaning provisions (access, tooling interfaces) exist and are compatible with cleaning method.

requirements.text: Online cleaning systems shall include monitoring of cleaning effectiveness and provisions to troubleshoot ball losses or flow path issues.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring points and procedures support verification of cleaning effectiveness.

requirements.text: Cathodic protection method {{cathodic_protection}} shall be defined for waterboxes and submerged surfaces where corrosion risk warrants.

verification.acceptance: CP design basis exists and installation meets design (anode placement, current) where applicable.

requirements.text: Coatings/linings in waterboxes and on tubesheets shall be specified with surface preparation, cure, inspection, and repair criteria to assure long-term performance.

verification.acceptance: Coating/lining specification includes prep/cure/inspection criteria and QA hold points.

requirements.text: The design shall limit erosive conditions at CW inlets/outlets via diffusers, turning vanes, or impingement protection where needed.

verification.acceptance: Velocity and erosion assessment demonstrates protective features are adequate.

requirements.text: Materials and coatings shall be compatible with planned chemical cleaning agents (if applicable) to prevent damage during cleaning evolutions.

verification.acceptance: Compatibility assessment exists for cleaning chemicals vs materials/coatings.

requirements.text: The condenser design shall address under-deposit corrosion and scaling risk and define monitoring/cleaning triggers.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring plan and triggers are defined and incorporated into maintenance program.

requirements.text: Biocide injection and sampling points shall be located to ensure effective mixing and avoid localized high concentrations that could damage materials.

verification.acceptance: Injection/sampling locations are shown on drawings and validated by design review.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to minimize stagnant zones in waterboxes (drainage, circulation) that could promote MIC.

verification.acceptance: Design review confirms drainage and circulation features reduce stagnant zones.

requirements.text: Gasket and elastomer materials used on vacuum boundaries and waterboxes shall be selected for compatibility with temperature, chemistry, and radiation where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Material compatibility review confirms gasket/elastomer suitability for service conditions.

requirements.text: For marine environments, the design shall address external corrosion protection (coatings, insulation, drainage) for the condenser shell and supports.

verification.acceptance: External corrosion protection details are specified and verified during installation.

requirements.text: The design shall include provisions to monitor and control CW-side silt, sand, and debris that drive erosion/fouling (e.g., differential pressure trending, strainers).

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation/maintenance plan includes DP trending and cleaning of strainers/screens.

requirements.text: Material traceability requirements (heat numbers, certifications) shall be defined for pressure boundary components and tubes consistent with QA level {{qa_level}}.

verification.acceptance: Material certifications and traceability records meet procurement and QA requirements.

requirement_sets.category: 7. Structural, pressure boundary, and mechanical design

requirements.text: The condenser shell and supports shall be designed for vacuum/external pressure, including collapse buckling margins under {{shell_external_pressure_design}} kPa external pressure as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Buckling/stress analysis demonstrates adequate margins for external pressure load cases.

requirements.text: The condenser steam-side pressure boundary shall be designed for the specified positive internal pressure {{shell_side_pressure_design}} kPa_g where applicable (e.g., steam blanketing, cleaning, abnormal events).

verification.acceptance: Stress analysis demonstrates design meets allowable limits for specified pressure.

requirements.text: Waterboxes and associated covers shall be designed for waterbox design pressure {{waterbox_design_pressure}} and include provisions for safe hydrostatic testing.

verification.acceptance: Design calculations and hydrotest records demonstrate compliance.

requirements.text: The condenser pressure boundary shall be designed for the design temperature {{design_temperature}} and applicable thermal transients.

verification.acceptance: Thermal stress evaluation meets allowable limits for defined temperature and transients.

requirements.text: Nozzles and supports shall be designed for external loads from connected piping (thermal expansion, weight, seismic) consistent with the piping code-of-record.

verification.acceptance: Nozzle load evaluation demonstrates acceptability for bounding piping loads.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include structural provisions to withstand circulating water water hammer and transient loads where credible.

verification.acceptance: Transient load evaluation demonstrates supports and boundaries withstand water hammer loads.

requirements.text: Tube bundle support structure shall be designed for differential thermal expansion between tubes, tubesheet, and shell without overstressing tubes or joints.

verification.acceptance: Thermal expansion/stress analysis demonstrates acceptable margins.

requirements.text: The design shall address fatigue for cyclic loads including startups/shutdowns and load following with design transients count {{design_transients_count}} where specified.

verification.acceptance: Fatigue evaluation demonstrates acceptable cumulative usage for defined transients.

requirements.text: Seismic loads shall be included for components designated Seismic Category I, including anchorage design and dynamic interaction with supports.

verification.acceptance: Seismic analysis and anchorage design meet seismic criteria; as-built anchorage matches design.

requirements.text: Where the condenser is non-seismic, interfaces to seismic systems shall include provisions (flexible joints, isolation) to prevent seismic interaction hazards.

verification.acceptance: Seismic interaction review demonstrates adequate separation or qualified interfaces.

requirements.text: Supports and foundations shall be designed for dead load, operating load, hydrotest load, and maintenance load cases (waterbox removal, tube pulling).

verification.acceptance: Support/foundation calculations include all required load cases and meet criteria.

requirements.text: Lifting lugs and rigging points (where provided) shall be designed, certified, and marked for intended lifts including maintenance lifts for waterbox covers.

verification.acceptance: Lifting devices are rated, inspected, and labeled with safe working load.

requirements.text: The design shall include provisions to prevent tube vibration damage due to CW flow and steam-side conditions, including support spacing and velocity limits.

verification.acceptance: Vibration assessment demonstrates acceptable margins against resonance and fatigue.

requirements.text: Gasketed joints on vacuum boundary shall be designed to maintain sealing under expected structural deflections and thermal movements.

verification.acceptance: Flange/gasket design assessment demonstrates sealing under defined movements/loads.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include protective features against internal debris impact (e.g., tube inlet shields) where debris loading could damage tubes.

verification.acceptance: Debris impact assessment and protective features are documented and installed.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be designed to accommodate inspection access (manways, removable panels) without compromising pressure boundary integrity.

verification.acceptance: Access features are provided and meet code requirements for openings and reinforcement.

requirements.text: Hydrostatic test pressure shall be specified as {{hydrotest_pressure}} kPa_g (or project-specific) and test procedures shall include acceptance criteria and hold times.

verification.acceptance: Hydrotest procedure and records demonstrate test performed and acceptance criteria met.

requirements.text: Nondestructive examination (NDE) methods and extent shall be specified for welds and critical joints consistent with the code-of-record and QA level.

verification.acceptance: NDE plan and records demonstrate required examinations were performed and accepted.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to mitigate external hazards (tornado missiles, flooding, fire) when applicable to its location and safety classification.

verification.acceptance: Hazard evaluations and design features demonstrate hazard mitigation consistent with plant strategy.

requirements.text: For safety-related condensers (e.g., shutdown condensers in some designs), design, fabrication, and testing shall meet applicable nuclear QA and qualification requirements.

verification.acceptance: Design/procurement and qualification records demonstrate compliance with nuclear QA requirements.

requirement_sets.category: 8. Tube integrity, leak tightness, and leak detection

requirements.text: The condenser shall include a tube integrity program basis defining inspection methods ({{inspection_method_tubes}}), intervals ({{inspection_interval_months}}), and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Tube integrity program basis exists and includes methods, intervals, and criteria.

requirements.text: The tube bundle shall be designed and fabricated to minimize tube-to-tubesheet leakage risk, including qualified joint processes and cleanliness controls.

verification.acceptance: Joint qualification and cleanliness controls are documented and verified.

requirements.text: A leak test method {{leak_test_method}} shall be specified for vacuum boundary and/or tube-side pressure boundaries, including acceptance leak rate ≤ {{max_allowable_leak_rate}}.

verification.acceptance: Leak test is performed and meets acceptance leak rate criteria.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include monitoring to detect tube leaks promptly, including condensate conductivity monitoring (≤ {{conductivity_max}} uS/cm alarm threshold) where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Conductivity instrumentation and alarms are installed, calibrated, and setpoints established.

requirements.text: For plants with radiological monitoring requirements, the condenser/hotwell shall include radiation monitors with defined alarm setpoints {{radiation_alarm_setpoint}}.

verification.acceptance: Radiation monitor is installed, calibrated, and alarm setpoint is implemented.

requirements.text: The design shall define an operating tube leakage limit of {{tube_leakage_operating_limit}} kg/h (or project-specific) and required operator response actions.

verification.acceptance: Leakage limits and response actions are documented in operating procedures.

requirements.text: Tube plugging methods and materials shall be defined and qualified, including provisions to track plugged tubes and maintain tube map records.

verification.acceptance: Plugging procedure is qualified and tube map/records tracking is implemented.

requirements.text: Where tube sleeving is used ({{tube_sleeving_method}}), sleeve design and qualification shall demonstrate structural integrity and leak tightness for intended life.

verification.acceptance: Sleeve qualification evidence demonstrates integrity and leak tightness.

requirements.text: The condenser design shall include provisions for eddy current testing access and tube end preparation compatible with planned inspection techniques.

verification.acceptance: Tube ends and access features support insertion and operation of inspection probes.

requirements.text: Tube material and fabrication shall meet applicable ASTM requirements and include verification of mechanical properties and dimensions.

verification.acceptance: Material certifications and inspection records confirm compliance to material specs.

requirements.text: Waterbox internal cleanliness and FME controls shall be applied during outages to prevent introduction of debris that can damage tubes.

verification.acceptance: FME controls are implemented and verified by inspection checklists.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to isolate and pressure test tube side or waterbox side sections to locate leakage sources during troubleshooting.

verification.acceptance: Isolation and test connections exist and procedures enable sectional testing.

requirements.text: Condenser air inleakage testing provisions (valves/ports) shall be provided to support periodic leak rate measurement and localization.

verification.acceptance: Test ports are installed and accessible; procedures include periodic measurement.

requirements.text: Where there is risk of cooling water contamination of condensate (tube leaks), the design shall support rapid detection and mitigation (isolation, load reduction guidance).

verification.acceptance: Procedures and control system guidance support timely mitigation actions.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include features to minimize tube fretting at support plates and tube wear due to vibration.

verification.acceptance: Wear/vibration assessment indicates acceptable margins; support design includes anti-wear features where needed.

requirements.text: Tube end regions shall be designed to mitigate crevice corrosion and facilitate cleaning/inspection (e.g., proper tube expansion length, seal welding where applicable).

verification.acceptance: Design details address crevice corrosion risk and are compatible with inspection/repair.

requirements.text: Repairs affecting pressure boundary or tube joints shall require qualified procedures and post-repair inspection/testing consistent with QA requirements.

verification.acceptance: Repair procedures are qualified and post-repair tests/inspections are documented.

requirements.text: The condenser shall maintain vacuum boundary integrity after maintenance evolutions, verified by post-maintenance leak testing.

verification.acceptance: Post-maintenance leak test results meet acceptance criteria prior to return to service.

requirements.text: Tube integrity trending shall be performed using inspection results to forecast end-of-life and support proactive maintenance planning.

verification.acceptance: Trending method exists and is used to plan maintenance and replacements.

requirements.text: Acceptance criteria shall be defined for tube repairs/plugging such that cumulative plugging does not exceed {{tube_plugging_limit_percent}}% without engineering evaluation.

verification.acceptance: Engineering evaluation is required and documented when plugging approaches/exceeds limit.

requirement_sets.category: 9. Cooling water integration, environmental compliance, and thermal discharge

requirements.text: Cooling water intake and discharge designs shall comply with applicable permits and regulatory requirements (e.g., NPDES) for flow, temperature, and chemical discharge.

verification.acceptance: Permit requirements are captured and design demonstrates compliance.

requirements.text: The condenser thermal discharge shall not exceed the permitted discharge temperature limit of {{discharge_temperature_limit}} C (or site-specific) under defined conditions.

verification.acceptance: Thermal discharge analysis and monitoring demonstrate compliance with limit.

requirements.text: The intake approach velocity shall meet environmental limits (≤ {{intake_velocity_limit}} m/s) where applicable to protect aquatic life.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic design demonstrates intake velocities meet the limit under bounding conditions.

requirements.text: Cooling water screening system type {{screening_system_type}} shall be selected to meet debris and environmental requirements and shall be maintainable during operation.

verification.acceptance: Screening system selection and maintenance plan satisfy design basis and regulatory requirements.

requirements.text: Backwash systems (if present) shall be sized and arranged to maintain screen performance and minimize condenser fouling.

verification.acceptance: Backwash system performance is demonstrated during commissioning and meets design basis.

requirements.text: Cooling water piping and condenser connections shall be designed to prevent air ingestion at low water levels and during transient intake conditions.

verification.acceptance: Hydraulic analysis demonstrates avoidance of vortexing/air ingestion for bounding conditions.

requirements.text: The design shall include provisions to monitor and control silt/debris loading that can drive fouling and erosion, including differential pressure across strainers/screens.

verification.acceptance: DP instrumentation and maintenance procedures exist for strainers/screens.

requirements.text: For cooling tower systems, the condenser design shall be compatible with basin water chemistry, drift, and treatment programs.

verification.acceptance: Compatibility assessment exists and is consistent with cooling tower chemistry program.

requirements.text: For once-through systems, the design shall address seasonal biological growth, zebra mussels (where applicable), and permit-driven treatment constraints.

verification.acceptance: Biofouling assessment and treatment strategy are documented and compliant.

requirements.text: The design shall minimize entrainment/impingement impacts consistent with intake technology best practice where required by regulations.

verification.acceptance: Intake design review addresses entrainment/impingement mitigation measures.

requirements.text: Chemical treatment injection points and monitoring shall be provided to control scaling/corrosion while meeting discharge limits.

verification.acceptance: Injection and monitoring points are installed and consistent with treatment program.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be designed for the expected range of CW solids and include provisions to prevent tube plugging or loss of flow due to debris.

verification.acceptance: Debris/solids design basis is defined and protective features are adequate.

requirements.text: Cooling water-side materials and coatings shall be selected to tolerate expected oxidant/biocide residuals used for biofouling control.

verification.acceptance: Compatibility assessment exists for materials/coatings vs oxidant residuals.

requirements.text: Cooling water discharge structures shall be designed to prevent recirculation of warm discharge water to the intake that would degrade condenser performance.

verification.acceptance: Thermal recirculation assessment demonstrates acceptable intake conditions.

requirements.text: Where marine growth is expected, provisions for periodic mechanical removal and inspection of intake structures and waterboxes shall be included.

verification.acceptance: Maintenance provisions and access are provided for marine growth control.

requirements.text: The design shall include monitoring points for CW inlet/outlet temperature and flow sufficient to demonstrate compliance with discharge permits and performance goals.

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation supports required monitoring and reporting.

requirements.text: Cooling water leakage paths shall be controlled to prevent uncontrolled discharge to the environment (e.g., waterbox drains routed appropriately).

verification.acceptance: Drain routing and containment meet site environmental controls.

requirements.text: The condenser and CW system shall include provisions to safely manage and dispose of cleaning wastes (chemical cleaning effluents) consistent with environmental permits.

verification.acceptance: Waste handling plan exists and aligns with permits for planned cleaning activities.

requirements.text: For plants using treated reuse water, the condenser design shall address scaling, biofouling, and chemistry control unique to reclaimed water.

verification.acceptance: Assessment documents risks and mitigation for treated reuse water service.

requirements.text: Operational limits for CW temperature and flow shall be defined to protect condenser materials and maintain compliance with environmental constraints.

verification.acceptance: Operating limits are documented and integrated into operating procedures/alarms.

requirement_sets.category: 10. Instrumentation, monitoring, controls, and performance testing

requirements.text: The condenser instrumentation package level shall be defined as {{instrumentation_package}} and include measurements required for performance monitoring and protection functions.

verification.acceptance: Instrumentation list matches defined package level and supports required functions.

requirements.text: Condenser vacuum/pressure measurement shall include at least {{vacuum_pressure_transmitters}} transmitters and provide alarms for low vacuum conditions.

verification.acceptance: Transmitters are installed, calibrated, and alarms function as intended.

requirements.text: CW inlet and outlet temperatures shall be measured with sufficient accuracy and quantity ({{temperature_sensors_count}}) to compute TTD and approach reliably.

verification.acceptance: Temperature sensors are installed, calibrated, and provide stable readings for performance calculations.

requirements.text: CW flow measurement shall be provided using a defined meter type {{flow_meter_type}} or an approved alternative and shall support performance testing.

verification.acceptance: Flow measurement method is installed and verified for required accuracy.

requirements.text: Hotwell level shall be controlled with redundant sensing where required by plant standards and include alarms to prevent turbine water induction.

verification.acceptance: Level control loop and alarms are implemented and tested during commissioning.

requirements.text: Conductivity monitoring shall be provided to detect tube leaks and protect plant chemistry, with alarm thresholds consistent with plant chemistry program.

verification.acceptance: Conductivity monitor is installed, calibrated, and alarm logic is implemented.

requirements.text: For radiological monitoring, condenser/hotwell radiation monitors shall interface with the plant alarm/annunciator system and support trending.

verification.acceptance: Monitor signals are integrated and alarm/trending functions verified.

requirements.text: Air removal system instrumentation shall include indications/alarms for key parameters (motive steam pressure, seal fluid flow, pump status) to support reliable operation.

verification.acceptance: I&C design includes required indications and alarms and is validated by commissioning checks.

requirements.text: Data logging interval for condenser performance signals shall be defined ({{data_logging_interval_s}}) and support diagnostic trending.

verification.acceptance: Data historian configuration supports required logging interval and retention.

requirements.text: The control system shall provide calculations or displays for condenser performance indicators (TTD, approach, cleanliness factor) using measured inputs.

verification.acceptance: Calculated indicators are available and validated against test calculations.

requirements.text: Alarm philosophy for condenser-related alarms shall follow {{alarm_philosophy}} and avoid nuisance alarms while ensuring timely operator response.

verification.acceptance: Alarm setpoints/priorities meet plant philosophy and are reviewed/approved.

requirements.text: Where online ball cleaning is used, instrumentation shall monitor ball circulation rate and indicate loss-of-balls conditions.

verification.acceptance: Ball monitoring instrumentation functions as intended and provides alarm on abnormal conditions.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions for periodic performance testing, including test connections and measurement uncertainty evaluation, consistent with {{performance_test_standard}}.

verification.acceptance: Performance test plan includes connections, uncertainty analysis, and acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Baseline performance testing shall be performed following installation when {{baseline_performance_test}} is true and results shall be preserved in plant records.

verification.acceptance: Baseline test is performed, accepted, and results are captured in controlled records.

requirements.text: Instrumentation used for acceptance testing shall be calibrated and traceable to recognized standards, and calibration records shall be controlled.

verification.acceptance: Calibration certificates exist and meet traceability requirements.

requirements.text: The condenser control system shall include permissives/interlocks to protect equipment during abnormal conditions (low CW flow, high hotwell level, vacuum pump trips).

verification.acceptance: Permissives/interlocks are implemented and validated during commissioning tests.

requirements.text: Where required, condenser instrumentation and control components important to safety shall be environmentally and seismically qualified.

verification.acceptance: Qualification records demonstrate seismic/EQ compliance for applicable I&C components.

requirements.text: The condenser monitoring system shall support early detection of degradation (air inleakage increase, fouling) through trending and alerts.

verification.acceptance: Trending reports/alerts exist and are used by maintenance/engineering.

requirements.text: Cyber/communications interfaces (if any) for condenser monitoring shall follow plant network and access control requirements.

verification.acceptance: Interfaces meet plant cyber/communications requirements and are documented.

requirements.text: Performance test data reduction methods and correction curves shall be documented, reviewed, and version controlled.

verification.acceptance: Data reduction method is documented and under configuration control.

requirements.text: For Seismic Category I condensers or subcomponents, seismic analysis shall include inertia loads, support stiffness, and interaction with adjacent structures.

verification.acceptance: Seismic analysis report demonstrates compliance with seismic criteria and includes interaction considerations.

requirements.text: Seismic anchorage hardware shall be specified, installed, and inspected to ensure as-built configuration matches design.

verification.acceptance: Anchorage inspection verifies correct hardware, embedment, torque, and configuration.

requirements.text: Seismic qualification of air removal equipment, controls, and instrumentation important to safety shall be documented per applicable standards.

verification.acceptance: Qualification reports/certificates exist for applicable equipment.

requirements.text: The condenser design shall address potential high energy line break effects in the vicinity (pipe whip, jet impingement) where applicable to plant design basis.

verification.acceptance: HELB evaluation and protective features are documented where required.

requirements.text: Where flood hazards apply, condenser and auxiliary equipment shall be protected or qualified consistent with plant flood protection strategy.

verification.acceptance: Flood protection/qualification measures are documented and implemented.

requirements.text: Where tornado missile hazards apply, condenser components required for safe operation shall be protected against missiles or evaluated for acceptability.

verification.acceptance: Missile protection or evaluation documentation exists and meets plant criteria.

requirements.text: Where fire hazards apply, condenser-related equipment important to safety shall be located/protected consistent with the plant fire protection program.

verification.acceptance: Fire protection features and separation comply with plant program requirements.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to manage internal hazards such as waterbox overpressure, vacuum collapse, and tube rupture transients.

verification.acceptance: Internal hazard analyses exist and protective features are implemented.

requirements.text: The condenser design shall address potential for water induction due to tube leaks or CW transients and include alarms and operational limits.

verification.acceptance: Design and procedures include water induction prevention/mitigation controls.

requirements.text: For systems credited in accident analyses, condenser performance assumptions and limits shall be documented and controlled.

verification.acceptance: Accident analysis inputs/assumptions are documented and controlled under configuration management.

requirements.text: Electrical equipment used for condenser auxiliaries shall meet applicable environmental conditions and protective device coordination requirements.

verification.acceptance: Equipment specifications match environmental conditions and coordination study covers loads.

requirements.text: Where EQ is required, electrical components important to safety shall be environmentally qualified per 10 CFR 50.49 and IEEE 323.

verification.acceptance: EQ documentation demonstrates compliance with required profiles.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions to prevent release of contaminants from condenser internals during abnormal events (e.g., tube rupture) consistent with plant programs.

verification.acceptance: Release pathways are evaluated and mitigations documented.

requirements.text: Where the condenser is located outdoors, design shall account for wind, snow/ice, and thermal environment loads consistent with site criteria.

verification.acceptance: Structural evaluation includes applicable environmental loads and meets criteria.

requirements.text: The condenser shall be evaluated for vibration from nearby rotating equipment and flow-induced excitation; supports shall mitigate resonance.

verification.acceptance: Vibration evaluation demonstrates acceptable margins; mitigations are implemented as needed.

requirements.text: If a vacuum relief/breaker device is used, it shall be qualified for expected opening cycles and environmental conditions.

verification.acceptance: Qualification evidence demonstrates capability for cycles and environment.

requirements.text: Hazard-specific operating procedures and training shall address loss of vacuum, tube leaks, and CW system upsets.

verification.acceptance: Procedures and training materials include required scenarios and response actions.

requirements.text: Condenser components designated important to safety shall be included in periodic surveillance and inspection programs consistent with plant commitments.

verification.acceptance: Surveillance/inspection program includes required components and intervals.

requirements.text: If the condenser includes safety-related isolation functions (e.g., shutdown condenser), isolation capability shall be demonstrated through testing.

verification.acceptance: Functional tests demonstrate isolation action meets timing and leakage criteria.

requirements.text: The design shall include provisions to prevent backflow or cross-contamination between cooling water and other plant systems via cross-connections.

verification.acceptance: Cross-connection review demonstrates backflow prevention and isolation measures are implemented.

requirement_sets.category: 12. Maintainability, access, ALARA, and outage readiness

requirements.text: The condenser shall provide manways and access openings sized and located to support waterbox inspection, cleaning, and tube repair activities.

verification.acceptance: Access openings meet sizing/location needs and are accessible with required clearances.

requirements.text: Confined space entry features (lighting, ventilation tie-ins, anchor points) shall be considered for waterbox entry where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Entry provisions are identified in design and support safe access.

requirements.text: Tube cleaning method {{tube_cleaning_method}} shall be supported by tooling access, tube end preparation, and waterbox geometry.

verification.acceptance: Physical configuration supports selected cleaning method without disassembly beyond planned scope.

requirements.text: Provision shall be made for safe removal and handling of waterbox covers and partition plates, including lifting points and laydown space.

verification.acceptance: Lifting/handling provisions are present and documented in maintenance procedures.

requirements.text: The design shall include adequate drains, vents, and purge points to support safe isolation and dewatering prior to maintenance.

verification.acceptance: Drain/vent points are accessible and allow complete dewatering and venting.

requirements.text: Gasket and fastener designs for waterbox covers shall support repeated maintenance cycles without excessive leakage or damage.

verification.acceptance: Design supports maintainable sealing and includes recommended torques and replacement intervals.

requirements.text: The condenser shall include provisions for tube plugging/sleeving execution (work platforms, tooling clearance) and for tracking tube status.

verification.acceptance: Work provisions and tracking methods are defined and implementable in the field.

requirements.text: Where practicable, the design shall support sectional isolation of waterboxes to permit partial maintenance without full condenser outage.

verification.acceptance: Isolation arrangement supports sectional maintenance and is documented on P&IDs.

requirements.text: ALARA considerations shall be applied where radiological contamination is possible, including minimizing dose rates during condenser maintenance and providing shielding where needed.

verification.acceptance: ALARA review performed and design incorporates dose reduction measures.

requirements.text: Labeling and identification (tags, flow direction, isolation boundaries) shall be provided to support correct maintenance and operation.

verification.acceptance: Field labeling matches drawings and supports maintenance procedures.

requirements.text: The design shall provide access for inspection of supports, anchors, and corrosion-prone areas (drains, low points, shell underside).

verification.acceptance: Access routes allow inspection and condition assessment of critical areas.

requirements.text: Maintenance planning shall include critical spares strategy {{spare_parts_strategy}} for air removal equipment, gaskets, and monitoring instrumentation.

verification.acceptance: Spares plan exists and aligns with criticality and lead times.

requirements.text: Vendor documentation shall include recommended maintenance tasks, intervals, and troubleshooting guidance for condenser auxiliaries and monitoring systems.

verification.acceptance: Vendor manuals provide maintenance guidance and are controlled in plant records.

requirements.text: A tube cleanliness monitoring approach shall be implemented to trigger cleaning before performance degradation impacts plant heat rate significantly.

verification.acceptance: Cleanliness monitoring and trigger thresholds exist and are used for planning.

requirements.text: Provisions shall exist to sample and drain waterbox sediments/sludge and to clean sludge deposition areas.

verification.acceptance: Sampling/drain points exist and maintenance procedures include sludge removal.

requirements.text: Design shall provide for safe chemical cleaning when used, including containment, venting, and materials compatibility documentation.

verification.acceptance: Chemical cleaning provisions and safety controls are defined and implementable.

requirements.text: The condenser layout shall include adequate clearance for tube bundle replacement or major component replacement consistent with shipping constraints {{shipping_constraints}}.

verification.acceptance: Removal paths and clearances are documented and verified against constraints.

requirements.text: Access controls and lockout/tagout points shall be provided for condenser auxiliaries (vacuum pumps, screen drives) to support safe maintenance.

verification.acceptance: LOTO points are identified and accessible; procedures reference them.

requirements.text: Maintenance-induced configuration changes (temporary blanks, jumpers) shall be controlled and independently verified before return to service.

verification.acceptance: Work controls include independent verification and restoration checks.

requirements.text: Outage readiness plans shall include condenser inspection scopes, tube inspection plans, and contingency repair strategies for tube leaks.

verification.acceptance: Outage plan includes condenser scopes and contingency strategies and is reviewed/approved.

requirement_sets.category: 13. QA, procurement, documentation, and configuration control

requirements.text: The condenser supplier shall implement a QA program commensurate with QA level {{qa_level}}, including control of design, procurement, fabrication, inspection, and records.

verification.acceptance: Supplier QA program is evaluated/approved and meets required criteria.

requirements.text: Commercial grade dedication (CGD) shall be performed for commercial items used in safety-related applications, including identification of critical characteristics.

verification.acceptance: CGD plan and records demonstrate critical characteristics were verified and accepted.

requirements.text: Procurement documents shall specify required material certifications and traceability for tubes, tubesheets, shells, and weld filler materials.

verification.acceptance: Material certs and traceability records are complete and match procurement requirements.

requirements.text: Welding procedures, welders, and welding operators shall be qualified and controlled for condenser pressure boundary welds.

verification.acceptance: Qualification records exist and are current for welding procedures and personnel.

requirements.text: NDE personnel and procedures shall be qualified and NDE records shall be controlled for required examinations.

verification.acceptance: NDE qualifications and records meet applicable standards and procurement requirements.

requirements.text: Hold points/witness points shall be defined for critical fabrication steps (tube expansion/welding, hydrotest, coating inspection).

verification.acceptance: ITP includes hold points and records show required inspections were completed.

requirements.text: Coating/lining application shall be controlled as a special process including surface preparation verification and holiday testing where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Special process controls and inspection records demonstrate compliant coating/lining application.

requirements.text: Nonconformance reporting and disposition shall be implemented for material, dimensional, and test deviations discovered during fabrication or installation.

verification.acceptance: NCR system exists and records show timely disposition and corrective actions.

requirements.text: Design changes after procurement shall be controlled through an approved change process ensuring impacts to performance, integrity, and permits are evaluated.

verification.acceptance: Change control records demonstrate impact evaluations and approvals.

requirements.text: As-built drawings and bill of materials shall be provided and reconciled with procurement and installation records.

verification.acceptance: As-built package matches installed configuration and includes required drawings/BOM.

requirements.text: Vendor data (performance curves, air removal capacities) shall be reviewed and accepted by engineering prior to installation and used for setting test acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Engineering review records exist and acceptance criteria align with reviewed data.

requirements.text: Traceability of tube materials to installation locations (tube map) shall be maintained where required by QA level and plant programs.

verification.acceptance: Tube map includes material traceability and is controlled.

requirements.text: Records retention requirements shall be defined for the condenser consistent with regulatory and plant record retention programs.

verification.acceptance: Records retention plan is documented and implemented.

requirements.text: The project shall define acceptance criteria for dimensional inspections (tube pitch, alignment, nozzle locations) and require documentation of results.

verification.acceptance: Dimensional inspection reports demonstrate compliance to acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Factory acceptance tests (FAT) shall be specified when {{factory_acceptance_test}} is required, including scope and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: FAT is performed per plan and results meet acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Site acceptance tests (SAT) shall be specified when {{site_acceptance_test}} is required, including alignment, leak testing, and functional checks.

verification.acceptance: SAT is performed per plan and results meet acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Software/firmware used for condenser monitoring or condition monitoring shall be version controlled and validated per plant QA practices.

verification.acceptance: Software is controlled (versions, changes) and validation records exist.

requirements.text: Procurement shall address counterfeit/fraudulent items prevention for safety-related condenser components and hardware.

verification.acceptance: CFI prevention measures are implemented and documented in procurement/receiving.

requirements.text: Receiving inspection shall verify critical characteristics, documentation completeness, and damage-free condition for delivered condenser components.

verification.acceptance: Receiving inspection records demonstrate verification and acceptance.

requirements.text: Configuration control shall maintain a list of approved condenser parts and materials (e.g., tube materials, gaskets, coatings) to prevent unauthorized substitutions.

verification.acceptance: Approved parts list exists and is used in procurement/maintenance.

requirement_sets.category: 14. Commissioning, inspections, periodic testing, and lifecycle monitoring

requirements.text: A commissioning plan shall be developed for the condenser including leak testing, vacuum pull-down testing, CW flushing, and performance verification.

verification.acceptance: Commissioning plan exists and includes defined tests with acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Prior to initial operation, the CW system and condenser shall be flushed/cleaned to remove construction debris and meet cleanliness acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Flush/cleaning records demonstrate acceptance criteria were met.

requirements.text: Initial vacuum pull-down testing shall demonstrate the condenser achieves {{vacuum_design}} kPa_abs within specified time and meets leakage criteria.

verification.acceptance: Vacuum pull-down test achieves required vacuum and leak rate acceptance criteria.

requirements.text: Hydrostatic testing of waterboxes and applicable boundaries shall be performed per code-of-record and documented.

verification.acceptance: Hydrotest completed and records demonstrate compliance with procedures and acceptance.

requirements.text: A baseline air inleakage measurement shall be performed after commissioning to establish reference performance for trending.

verification.acceptance: Baseline air inleakage value is measured and recorded for trending.

requirements.text: Baseline condenser performance test shall be conducted when {{baseline_performance_test}} is true and results used to set cleanliness factor reference.

verification.acceptance: Baseline performance test results are recorded and used as reference for cleanliness factor.

requirements.text: Periodic performance monitoring shall be implemented to detect degradation (fouling, air inleakage) and trigger corrective actions.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring program exists and includes corrective action triggers and responsibilities.

requirements.text: Periodic inspections of waterboxes, tubesheets, and internal coatings/linings shall be performed at intervals consistent with the maintenance basis.

verification.acceptance: Inspection records exist and include findings, repairs, and follow-up actions.

requirements.text: Tube inspection (e.g., eddy current/visual) shall be performed at the defined interval and results shall be evaluated against acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Inspection results are recorded and acceptance evaluation is documented.

requirements.text: Tube cleaning effectiveness shall be verified through performance indicators (cleanliness factor) and/or inspection results.

verification.acceptance: Cleaning effectiveness verification demonstrates improvement or meets threshold criteria.

requirements.text: For online ball cleaning systems, periodic functional testing shall verify injection/collection and monitoring functions.

verification.acceptance: Functional test demonstrates proper ball circulation and monitoring alarms.

requirements.text: Air removal equipment shall be periodically tested to demonstrate hogging/holding performance remains within acceptance limits.

verification.acceptance: Test results demonstrate air removal capacity within acceptance limits.

requirements.text: Calibration and functional checks of condenser instrumentation (vacuum, temperature, conductivity, radiation monitors) shall be performed per plant calibration program.

verification.acceptance: Calibration records demonstrate instruments are calibrated and functional.

requirements.text: Condition monitoring (where implemented) shall include data review routines and thresholds to generate actionable maintenance work requests.

verification.acceptance: Condition monitoring process includes review frequency, thresholds, and linkage to work management.

requirements.text: An aging management approach shall be implemented when {{aging_management_program}} is required, addressing corrosion, erosion, fatigue, and coating degradation.

verification.acceptance: Aging management plan exists and includes inspection/mitigation strategies for degradation mechanisms.

requirements.text: Post-maintenance testing shall be performed after opening the condenser vacuum boundary or waterboxes, including leak testing and functional checks.

verification.acceptance: Post-maintenance tests are completed and meet acceptance criteria before return to service.

requirements.text: Lessons learned from tube leaks, fouling events, or air inleakage excursions shall be captured and used to update maintenance and operating practices.

verification.acceptance: Corrective action records show lessons learned incorporated into procedures/programs.

requirements.text: Periodic inspection of supports and anchorage shall be performed to identify corrosion, loosening, or settlement that could affect alignment and integrity.

verification.acceptance: Support inspection records exist and corrective actions are taken as needed.

requirements.text: Environmental monitoring and reporting required by permits (temperature, chemicals) shall be implemented with data retention consistent with regulatory requirements.

verification.acceptance: Monitoring data is collected, retained, and reported per permit requirements.

requirements.text: Periodic review of condenser performance models and correction curves shall be performed to ensure continued validity as plant conditions change.

verification.acceptance: Model review records exist and updates are controlled under configuration management.
